meanings.definition: A person or group of people who carry a coffin at a funeral.
meanings.sent1: The pallbearers solemnly carried the coffin to the gravesite.
meanings.sent2: During the funeral, the pallbearers carefully lifted the casket.
meanings.sent3: The pallbearers made sure to walk slowly and steadily with the coffin.
meanings.sent4: As the pallbearers moved forward, the weight of the coffin felt heavier with each step.
meanings.sent5: The image of the pallbearers carrying the coffin stayed with me long after the funeral.

meanings.definition: Those who assist in carrying a casket during a funeral procession.
meanings.sent1: The pallbearers helped carry the casket with respect and care.
meanings.sent2: Family members often serve as pallbearers to honor their loved one.
meanings.sent3: The pallbearers coordinated their steps to ensure a smooth procession.
meanings.sent4: The role of pallbearers is crucial in maintaining the dignity of the funeral.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the pallbearers walking in unison was a poignant moment during the service.
